title: Gift your Valentine the ability to digitize old film and slides with the Kodak Slide N Scan, now $180
content:
Macworld

With Valentine’s Day just around the corner, you might be struggling to find a special gift for a loved one who loves all things film. We have a suggestion: a Kodak film and slide scanner.

This Kodak device is perfect for reviving old memories and keeping them fresh for years to come. It offers a non-destructive way to digitize and correct slides and film. Through February 4, the Kodak Slide N Scan is only $179.99 (reg. $224) and comes with free shipping.

Offering a 14MP image sensor that enhances resolution up to 22 megapixels, this Kodak scanner is also designed with a quick-feeding tray so your Valentine can load film and slides easily. This device can preserve and scan color and B&W negatives (135, 110, 126) and 50 mm slides (135, 110, 126), and users can use the scanner’s built-in tools to change the orientation and correct color.

Your Valentine can fully immerse themselves in their newly digitized memory thanks to its 5″ LCD display. They can even share their digitized film and slides with friends and family by connecting the Kodak scanner to their TV, PC, or Mac for a slideshow experience.

Get the Kodak Slide N Scan while it’s discounted to just $179.99 with free shipping. No coupon is required, but we recommend ordering on or before February 4 at 11:59 p.m. PT so it arrives by Valentine’s Day!
